description: Bacillus anthracis, the organism that causes anthrax. It is large Gram positive aerobic spore bearing bacillus and is the only obligate pathogen within the genus bacillus. B. anthracis is nonmotile and nonhemolytic on blood agar, catalase-positive, exhibits lysis by gamma-bacteriophage, and is susceptible to penicillin. B. anthracis has two major virulence factors, which are encoded on separate plasmids.
name: Bacillus anthracis Antibodies and Antigens
